gololang

Class Predefined

  • java.lang.Object
    • gololang.Predefined

  • public final class Predefined
extends java.lang.Object
    Predefined provides the module of predefined functions in Golo. The provided module is imported by default.

                    throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                           java.lang.AssertionError
        Requires that a condition be true.
        Parameters:

        errorMessage - the error message, must be a String.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the arguments are of the wrong type.
        java.lang.AssertionError - if condition is false.

      • range

        public static java.lang.Object range(java.lang.Object from,
                                     java.lang.Object to)
        Makes an range object between two bounds. Range objects implement java.lang.Collection (immutable), so they can be used in Golo foreach loops.
        Parameters:
        from - the lower-bound (inclusive) as an Integer, Long, Character or BigInteger.
        to - the upper-bound (exclusive) as an Integer, Long, Character or BigInteger.
        Returns:
        a range object.
        See Also:
        Collection

      • range

        public static java.lang.Object range(java.lang.Object to)
        Makes an range object starting from the default value.

        The default value is 0 for numbers and 'A' for chars.

        Parameters:
        to - the upper-bound (exclusive) as an Integer, Long, Character or BigInteger.
        Returns:
        a range object.
        See Also:
        range(java.lang.Object, java.lang.Object)

      • reversedRange

        public static java.lang.Object reversedRange(java.lang.Object from,
                                             java.lang.Object to)
        Makes an decreasing range object between two bounds. Range objects implement java.lang.Collection, so they can be used in Golo foreach loops.
        Parameters:
        from - the upper-bound (inclusive) as an Integer, Long, Character or BigInteger.
        to - the lower-bound (exclusive) as an Integer, Long, Character or BigInteger.
        Returns:
        a range object.
        See Also:
        range(java.lang.Object, java.lang.Object)

      • reversedRange

        public static java.lang.Object reversedRange(java.lang.Object from)
        Makes an decreasing range object up to the default value.

        The default value is 0 for numbers and 'A' for chars.

        Parameters:
        from - the upper-bound (inclusive) as an Integer, Long, Character or BigInteger.
        Returns:
        a range object.
        See Also:
        reversedRange(java.lang.Object, java.lang.Object), range(java.lang.Object, java.lang.Object)

      • asFunctionalInterface

        public static java.lang.Object asFunctionalInterface(java.lang.Object type,
                                                     java.lang.Object func)
                                              throws java.lang.Throwable
        Turns a function reference into an instance of a Java 8 functional interface. The implementation delegates to Golo adapter fabrics.
        Parameters:
        type - the functional interface class.
        func - the implementation function.
        Returns:
        an instance of type.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Throwable - if the adaptation fails.
        See Also:
        GoloAdapter

        Returns:

      • fun

        @WithCaller
public static FunctionReference fun(java.lang.Class<?> caller,
                                                java.lang.Object name,
                                                java.lang.Object module,
                                                java.lang.Object arity,
                                                java.lang.Object varargs)
                                         throws java.lang.Throwable
        Obtains a reference to a function.
        Parameters:
        name - the function name.
        module - the function enclosing module (a Java class).
        arity - the function arity, where a negative value means that any arity will do.
        varargs - if the functions has variable arity.
        Returns:
        a function reference to the matched function.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NoSuchMethodException - if the target function could not be found.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the argument types are not of types (String, Class, Integer).
        java.lang.Throwable - if an error occurs.

      • fun

        @WithCaller
public static FunctionReference fun(java.lang.Class<?> caller,
                                                java.lang.Object name,
                                                java.lang.Object module,
                                                java.lang.Object arity)
                                         throws java.lang.Throwable
        Obtains the first reference to a function.

        This is the same as calling fun(name, module, arity, false).

        Throws:
        java.lang.Throwable
        See Also:
        fun(Class, Object, Object, Object, Object)

      • fun

        @WithCaller
public static FunctionReference fun(java.lang.Class<?> caller,
                                                java.lang.Object name,
                                                java.lang.Object module)
                                         throws java.lang.Throwable
        Obtains the first reference to a function.

        This is the same as calling fun(name, module, -1).

        Throws:
        java.lang.Throwable
        See Also:
        fun(Class, Object, Object, Object)

      • textToFile

        @Deprecated
public static void textToFile(java.lang.Object text,
                                          java.lang.Object file)
                                   throws java.lang.Throwable
        Deprecated. Since 3.3, use IO.textToFile(Object, Object). Will be removed in 4.0
        Writes some text to a file. The file and parents directories are created if they does not exist. The file is overwritten if it already exists. If the file is "-", the content is written to standard output.
        Parameters:
        text - the text to write.
        file - the file to write to as an instance of either String, File or Path.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Throwable

      • textToFile

        @Deprecated
public static void textToFile(java.lang.Object text,
                                          java.lang.Object file,
                                          java.lang.Object charset)
                                   throws java.lang.Throwable
        Deprecated. Since 3.3, use IO.textToFile(Object, Object, Object). Will be removed in 4.0
        Writes some text to a file using the given Charset. The file and parents directories are created if they does not exist. The file is overwritten if it already exists. If the file is "-", the content is written to standard output.
        Parameters:
        text - the text to write.
        file - the file to write to as an instance of either String, File or Path.
        charset - the charset to encode the text in.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Throwable

      • str

        public static java.lang.String str(java.lang.Object... args)
        Create a String by concatenating all arguments.

        For instance: 

        
 let s = str("The answer", " is ", 2 * 21)
        This is functionally equivalent to: 
        
 let s = ["The answer", " is ", 2 * 21]: join("")

      • removeByIndex

        public static java.lang.Object removeByIndex(java.util.List<?> lst,
                                             java.lang.Integer idx)
        Removes an element of a List by index.
        Parameters:
        lst - the list to remove the element from.
        idx - an Integer representing the index of the element to remove.
        Returns:
        the element that was removed.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - if idx

      • box

        public static java.lang.Object box(java.lang.Object obj)
        Returns a box containing the given object.

        Useful whenever an explicit reference is needed, for instance to create a closure with internal mutable state: 

        
    function counter = |init| {
      let current = box(init)
      return -> current: getAndSet(current: get() + 1)
    }

    let c = counter(3)
    c() # 3
    c() # 4
    c() # 5
        Parameters:
        obj - the object to reference.
        Returns:
        a java.util.concurrent.atomic.AtomicReference instance wrapping the object

        Returns:
        a list of the given values.

      • special

        @Macro
public static GoloElement<?> special(GoloFunction fun)
        Macro to define a special macro.

        A special macro is a macro whose first implicit parameter is the expansion visitor itself.

        For instance: 

        
 @special
 macro mySpecialMacro = |visitor, arg| {
   ...
 }

      • contextual

        @Macro
public static GoloElement<?> contextual(GoloFunction fun)
        Macro to define a contextual macro.

        A contextual macro is a macro whose first implicit parameter is the macro call itself.

        For instance: 

        
 @contextual
 macro mySpecialMacro = |self, arg| {
   ...
 }
